result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl M. Pierce

records.addlTxt:
11:54 AM Defendant Darryl M. Pierce appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Toni L. Young in court for Darryl M. Pierce.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  No objection to DE's appearance by zoom today. DE motion for modification of bond to SB. DE eligible for vivitrol program. DE has untreated medical issues while IC.  State objects.  Court denies motion to modify bond.   STC 1/13 9am. Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:00 am.
to Attorney Young from E. Hartnell KCJ Discharge Coordinator regarding vivitrol program
Defendant's Motion for Bond Reduction

10:16 AM Defendant Darryl M. Pierce appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Toni L. Young in court for Darryl M. Pierce.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM.  No objection to zoom appearance today.  DE accepted in the vivitrol program. Bond motion to be filed.  BBH scheduled.  Bond continued.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Toni Young

Defendant Darryl M. Pierce in court, in custody.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms.   *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.   No drug paraphenalia.
